ADSP Project Backend

MLFlow Backend Plugin For Anaconda Data Science Platform Definition

class mlflow_adsp.backend.ADSPProjectBackend(*, aeSession: AEUserSession)

Bases: AbstractBackend, BaseModel

Anaconda Data Science Platform Backend Sub-classes the MLFlow AbstractBackend used for backend management.

ae_session: AEUserSession
run(project_uri: str, entry_point: str, params: Dict, version: str, backend_config: Dict | str, tracking_uri: str, experiment_id: str) → ADSPSubmittedRun

The entry point for the execution. Invoked by mlflow.projects.run when the backend is specified. See https://mlflow.org/docs/2.3.0/python_api/mlflow.projects.html#mlflow.projects.run for in-depth details on these parameters.

Parameters:

  • project_uri (str) – URI of project to run.

  • entry_point (str) – Entry point to run within the project.

  • params (Dict) – Parameters (dictionary) for the entry point command.

  • version (str) – For Git-based projects, either a commit hash or a branch name.

  • backend_config (Union[Dict, str]) – A dictionary, or a path to a JSON file (must end in ‘.json’), which will be passed as config to the backend.

  • tracking_uri (str) – The Tracking Server URI. Within our backend this is controlled through environment variables. While passed by the caller it is ignored in this implementation.

  • experiment_id (str) – The experiment ID for the current execution context.

Returns:

submitted_job – An instance of an ADSPSubmittedRun used for tracking and managing the backend run.

Return type:

ADSPSubmittedRun

mlflow_adsp.backend.adsp_backend_builder() → AbstractBackend

This function will act as our handler for setting up the plugin.

This function is responsible for: 1. Creating an Anaconda Data Science Platform Session and Connecting. 2. Instantiating an Anaconda Data Science Platform Backend with the created session.

Returns:

backend – An instance of the plugin.

Return type:

ADSPProjectBackend

Serve

Wraps mlflow serve. This is not meant to be executed directly, but called through the cli command mlflow-adsp.

ADSP Submitted Run

Anaconda Data Science Platform Submitted Run Definition

class mlflow_adsp.submitted_run.ADSPSubmittedRun(*, aeSession: AEUserSession, mlflowRunId: str, adspJobId: str, response: Dict, waitInterval: int = 15)

Bases: SubmittedRun, BaseModel

Anaconda Data Science Platform Submitted Run Sub-classes the MLFlow SubmittedRun used for backend management.

ae_session

An Anaconda Data Science Platform session used for communication with the platform.

Type:

AEUserSession

mlflow_run_id

The MLFlow Run ID for the current context.

Type:

str

adsp_job_id

The Anaconda Data Science Platform Job ID

Type:

str

response

A dictionary response of the job creation request.

Type:

Dict

adsp_job_id: str
ae_session: AEUserSession
cancel() → None

Cancels a run’s execution

get_log() → str

Gets the [current] logs for the job run.

Returns:

log – A string representation of the run output.

Return type:

str

get_status() → RunStatus

Gets the current status of the run.

Returns:

status – Returns an MLFlow run status for the Anaconda Data Science Platform run status.

Return type:

RunStatus

mlflow_run_id: str
response: Dict
property run_id

run_id Property

Returns:

run_id – The MLFlow Run ID for the context.

Return type:

str

wait() → bool

Waits for the run to complete then returns the success status.

Returns:

success – Returns True/False based on successful run execution.

Return type:

bool

wait_interval: int
